[File: third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/legacy-move-compiler/src/shared/mod.rs] [Enum: LanguageVersion] [Version enum exhaustiveness] Are all match statements on LanguageVersion exhaustive, or can future version additions cause unhandled cases leading to panics? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/legacy-move-compiler/src/shared/mod.rs] [Function: LanguageVersion::to_ordinal()] [Ordering inconsistency] Does to_ordinal() maintain strict version ordering, or can V2 == V2_1 create ambiguity in version checks causing security bypasses? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/legacy-move-compiler/src/shared/mod.rs] [Trait: PartialEq for LanguageVersion] [Equality bypass] The custom PartialEq compares ordinals instead of variants - can this allow V2 and V2_1 to be treated as equal when they should be distinct for feature gating? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/legacy-move-compiler/src/shared/mod.rs] [Trait: Ord for LanguageVersion] [Version ordering attack] Can an attacker exploit the ordinal-based comparison to make newer language versions appear older, bypassing feature restrictions? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/legacy-move-compiler/src/shared/mod.rs] [Enum: LanguageVersion variants] [Version gap exploitation] Are there security implications from the V2_0 to V2_5 version gap where intermediate versions might have unpatched vulnerabilities? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/legacy-move-compiler/src/shared/mod.rs] [Enum: AttributePosition] [Position validation bypass] Can attributes be applied to incorrect positions if the validation logic fails, allowing #[test] on modules or #[native] on structs? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/legacy-move-compiler/src/shared/mod.rs] [Trait: AttributeKind] [Trait implementation gaps] If a type implements AttributeKind incorrectly, can it report wrong expected_positions allowing attribute misplacement attacks? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/legacy-move-compiler/src/shared/mod.rs] [Function: KnownAttribute::resolve()] [Attribute name collision] Can two different attributes with similar names cause resolve() to return the wrong variant, bypassing security checks? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/legacy-move-compiler/src/shared/mod.rs] [Function: KnownAttribute::resolve()] [Case sensitivity bypass] Does resolve() perform case-sensitive matching, or can #[Test] vs #[test] bypass test-only restrictions? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/legacy-move-compiler/src/shared/mod.rs] [Function: KnownAttribute::add_attribute_names()] [Duplicate attributes] Can duplicate attribute names be added to the table causing validation confusion where the same attribute is checked multiple times? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/legacy-move-compiler/src/shared/mod.rs] [Enum: KnownAttribute] [Attribute variant confusion] Can pattern matching on KnownAttribute variants miss newly added variants causing security checks to be skipped? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/legacy-move-compiler/src/shared/mod.rs] [Enum: TestingAttribute::Test] [Test execution in production] Can #[test] functions be called in production builds if the test flag is manipulated or if the position validation fails? (Critical)
